document.docTitle: Rythabis asymmetrica Markhaseva & Schulz 2007, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of Brodskius, Rythabis, and Omorius (Crustacea: Calanoida) from deep Antarctic waters

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Brodskius, Rythabis, and Omorius (Crustacea: Calanoida) from deep Antarctic waters

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype : adult female, dissected, body length 1.35 mm ( ZMH K-41168). Scotia Sea,
58 ° 24 9 S
,
25 ° 01 9 W
, station 141-10, supranet,
23 February 2002
, above the sea bed at depths of
2258–2281 m
.
Paratype : dissected, body length 1.28 mm ( ZMH K-41169), locality data as for holotype
.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 4.
Rythabis asymmetrica
sp. nov. , female. (A) Habitus, lateral; (B) habitus, dorsal; (C) cephalosome anterior, lateral; (D) posterior prosome and ursosome, dorsal; (E) posterior prosome and urosome, lateral; (F) posterior prosome and genital double-somite, lateral; (G) posterior prosome and genital double-somite, lateral; (H) genital double somite, right lateral. (A, B, E, H) Paratype; (C, D, F, G) holotype. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Antennule ( Figures 4A , 5A ) exceeding anterior margin of pedigerous somite 4; of 24 free segments, armature as follows: I—3s, II–IV—6s+1ae, V—2s+1 ae, VI—2s, VII—2s+1 ae, VIII—2s, IX—2s+1ae; X–XI—4s+1ae, XII–XIII—1s; XIV—2s+1ae, XV—1s, XVI— 2s+1ae, XVII–XIX—1s each, XX—2s, XXI—1s+1ae, XXII–XXIII—1s each, XXIV– XXVI—2s each, XXVII–XXVIII—4s+1 ae.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 5.
Rythabis asymmetrica
sp. nov. , female, paratype. (A) Antennule; (B) antenna, endopod segment 2 omitted; (C) antenna, endopod segment 2; (D) mandible, palp; (E) mandible, endopod; (F, G) mandible, gnathobase; (H) maxillule; (I) P5, posterior. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

Figure 6.
Rythabis asymmetrica
sp. nov. , female, paratype. (A) Maxilla, praecoxal, coxal and proximal basal endites, posterior; (B) maxilla, proximal basal endite and distal basal endite plus endopod, setae of proximal basal endite not figured; (C) maxilliped, syncoxa and basis; (D) maxilliped, syncoxa; (E) maxilliped, endopod; (F) P1, anterior; (G) P1, right endopod, anterior. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

Figure 7.
Rythabis asymmetrica
sp. nov. , female, paratype. (A) P2, posterior; (B) P3, posterior; (C) P4, posterior. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The specific name
asymmetrica
refers to the asymmetrical shape of the prosomal posterior corners.

Schulz and Beckmann (1995) placed the genus
Rythabis
in the family Tharybidae . This affiliation was supported by Bradford-Grieve (2001) and Vyshkvartzeva (2005) but was not accepted by Ohtsuka et al. (2003) and Boxshall and Halsey (2004) , who included the genus in the Scolecitrichidae . Markhaseva and Ferrari (2005) considered the family placement as incompletely resolved.
Rythabis
accommodates
R. atlantica Schulz, 1995
,
R. schulzi Markhaseva and Ferrari, 2005
, and
R. heptneri Markhaseva and Ferrari, 2005
.
Rythabis asymmetrica
differs from congeners by: (1) posterior corners of prosome asymmetrical (symmetrical in other species of
Rythabis
); (2) elongate spermathecae, which are frontally directed in distal half (not directed frontally, or moderately frontally directed); (3) presence of 14 setae on the distal basal endite plus endopod of maxillule (17 setae in
R. atlantica
, 11 in
R. heptneri
, 13 in
R. schulzi
). The new species shares with
R. atlantica
an articulated terminal spine on P5 exopod (unarticulated in other species of
Rythabis
) and two setae on the antenna endopod segment 1 (one seta) and thus appears more closely related to this species than to any other.
